intro: Picradeniopsis xylopoda, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a tropical tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display. The tree thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for warm climates.
